qas.question: What was attacked by Soviet troops on January 13?
Where was the TV Tower located?
What were the Soviets hoping to stop?
How many civilians died in the attack?
What was attacked by Russians on July 31?

context: On January 13, 1991, Soviet troops, along with the KGB Spetsnaz Alpha Group, stormed the <a0_0>Vilnius TV Tower<a0_0/> in <a1_0>Lithuania<a1_0/> to suppress the <a2_0>independence movement<a2_0/>. <a3_0>Fourteen<a3_0/> unarmed civilians were killed and hundreds more injured. On the night of July 31, 1991, Russian OMON from Riga, the Soviet military headquarters in the Baltics, assaulted the <a4_0>Lithuanian border post in Medininkai<a4_0/> and killed seven Lithuanian servicemen. This event further weakened the Soviet Union's position internationally and domestically, and stiffened Lithuanian resistance.
